channel.title: Hep with PVP armors
channel.description: Well ive recently added pvp armors to my server and when i put statius plate or vesta plate on it looks all glitchy, is there anyway to fix this?

item.title: Hep with PVP armors

item.description:

well yeah their all in the correct slots :o
and they are in item.java

Oh really? Sorry I did not no, thanks for saying lol. Just kinda upset me cuz i helped several ppl last night and no one even said thanks… >.> Kinda gets annoying, know what i mean?

item.title: Hep with PVP armors
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

[quote=“Danielplanto, post:2, topic:368605”]If you didnt add it to Item.java under the correct Wear-placement, then it will look glitchy. For example, if you wield them as weapons then that is your problem. And if you do, go to Item.java (SERVER SIDED) and under body{####, ####, add their ids, and also make sure they are under all body’s, such as platebody{####, #### (in mine there is Body and Platebody, so look out for both)

Compile, and restart ur server.

Run the game and they wnt look glitchy.

If this solves ur prob, please rep++ me :)[/quote]
Don’ t ask for rep broski, its against the rules.

Read full topic

item.title: Hep with PVP armors
item.dc:creator: @Danielplanto Danielplanto
item.description:
@Danielplanto wrote:

If you didnt add it to Item.java under the correct Wear-placement, then it will look glitchy. For example, if you wield them as weapons then that is your problem. And if you do, go to Item.java (SERVER SIDED) and under body{####, ####, add their ids, and also make sure they are under all body’s, such as platebody{####, #### (in mine there is Body and Platebody, so look out for both)

Compile, and restart ur server.

Run the game and they wnt look glitchy.

Read full topic
